Mr. Harold E« Hill
2
January 15, I960
As far as the itinerary and budget goes I ecu Id like to use all of the
money for travel and communication. Perhaps we could set a little
aside for me to use on long distance charges particularly in this
initial setting up phase. I would prefer to keep the decisions cm
the Itinerary until later. The first thing to be done is to send
out letters to the various people in the field who might be in a
position to supply some material. The itinerary of visits would then
be more meaningful since we would know where we might unearth some
useful material. Basically, I think a visit to headquarters is in
line and then a swing throu^i the east picking up two or three loca¬
tions. Any other visits will depend on the money available. I*m
not trying to hedge on setting up this itinerary. This would be a
very easy thing to do but, in the interest of getting as much out
of the money as possible, I would like very much to wait until I
have had some answers to my letters •
If this meets with your approval I will get the letters on the way
at once# If a sum can be set aside to cover long distance calls I
could follow up some of these letters with calls to specific loca¬
tions. I think a sum of #50.00 would be sufficient to cover these
first calls.
I hope this helps bring the picture into some kind of focus. One
other thing I would suggestjthat during my visit to the east, I stop
in to talk with the people at the U.S. Office of Education in
Washington. Again this might be something that could be better
handled by you or Harry.
Cordially,
Chairman, Television
Utilization Sub-committee
CRT/gvn
c.c. Harry Skomia
